intro: Dinemandra glaberrima, commonly known as the smoothleaf dinemandra, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, glabrous bark and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its drought tolerance, it is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, semi-desert environments.
